dt: {bc}a mystifying, misleading, or puzzling question posed as a problem to be solved or guessed {bc}{sx|conundrum||}, {sx|enigma||}

pt: {sc}mystery{/sc} {sc}problem{/sc} {sc}enigma{/sc} {sc}riddle{/sc} {sc}puzzle{/sc} mean something which baffles or perplexes. {sc}mystery{/sc} applies to what cannot be fully understood by reason or less strictly to whatever resists or defies explanation.
{sc}problem{/sc} applies to a question or difficulty calling for a solution or causing concern.
{sc}enigma{/sc} applies to utterance or behavior that is very difficult to interpret.
{sc}riddle{/sc} suggests an enigma or problem involving paradox or apparent contradiction.

pt.t: the {it}riddle{/it} of the reclusive pop star

pt: {sc}puzzle{/sc} applies to an enigma or problem that challenges ingenuity for its solution.

pt.t: the thief's motives were a {it}puzzle{/it} for the police

et: Middle English {it}redels, ridel{/it}, from Old English {it}rǣdelse{/it} opinion, conjecture, riddle; akin to Old English {it}rǣdan{/it} to interpret {ma}{mat|read|}{/ma}
shortdef: a mystifying, misleading, or puzzling question posed as a problem to be solved or guessed : conundrum, enigma
something or someone difficult to understand
to speak in or propound riddles
to find the solution of : explain
to set a riddle for : puzzle

et: Middle English {it}ridel,{/it} going back to Old English {it}hriddel{/it} (attested once), alteration (by dissimilation or suffix substitution) of {it}hridder, hrīder,{/it} going back to Germanic {it}*hrīdra-{/it} (whence also Old Saxon {it}hrīdra{/it} "sieve," Old High German {it}rītera{/it}), going back to Indo-European {it}*krei̯(h{inf}1{/inf})̯-dhro-{/it} or {it}*krei̯(h{inf}1{/inf})̯-tro-{/it} (whence Latin {it}crībrum{/it} "sieve," Old Irish {it}críathar,{/it} Old Welsh {it}cruitr{/it} "winnowing fan"), from {it}*krei̯(h{inf}1{/inf})-{/it} "sift, separate" + {it}*-dhro-, *-tro-,{/it} suffixes of instrument {ma}{mat|certain:1|}{/ma}

dt: {bc}to separate (something, such as grain from chaff) with a riddle {bc}{sx|screen||}
